title: TravelMug
author: TravelMug
created_time: October 15, 2023, 04:58:55 AMLast edit: October 15, 2023, 05:26:47 AM by TravelMug
content: What Happened: Scam/Fake BNB AirdropWebsite: Code:https://airdorp-tokens.app/Archived: https://archive.md/wSqAYWhois information:Code:Registrar Tucows Domains IncIANA ID: 69URL: http://www.tucows.comWhois Server: whois.nic.google(p)Registrar Status addPeriod, clientTransferProhibited, clientUpdateProhibitedDates 1 days oldCreated on 2023-10-13Expires on 2024-10-13Updated on 2023-10-15Original site: https://dappbay.bnbchain.org/campaign/bnb-chain-airdrop-marathonTake note that the scam site is very similar UI looking from the original. And just like the rest, this fake sites will immediately ask you to connect your wallet and that's how you get phished.And clearly, this website just pop up from the wild, just 1 day old.Regardless, it is already up and criminals just waiting for noobs to fall for this trick.And for those who are interested to report: I've written this as well, [Guide]: How and Where to Report Phishing Websites..Also report here: https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/?hl=en. It will take just a couple of minutes of your time.

comments.author: mormage
comments.body: Thanks for the heads up! Scammers are always coming up with new tricks. It's essential to stay vigilant and verify the authenticity of any airdrop or website.

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: Quote from: mormage on October 15, 2023, 12:36:23 PMThanks for the heads up! Scammers are always coming up with new tricks. It's essential to stay vigilant and verify the authenticity of any airdrop or website.It's not a new trick, in my opinion, it's trick that has been known already. However, there are still many gullible crypto newbies who still fall for this kind of trick that's why scammers are just rehearsing everything.They are picking up the hottest trend on crypto world and then try to copy that website at best spread the world thru different forums or even they are willing to pay ads on Google so that their fake and phishing website are on top. So once someone search for it, they will be on page 1 and everyone thought it is the legit once since it is appearing on the very top of big G.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: TravelMug on October 15, 2023, 04:58:55 AMOriginal site: https://dappbay.bnbchain.org/campaign/bnb-chain-airdrop-marathonTake note that the scam site is very similar UI looking from the original. And just like the rest, this fake sites will immediately ask you to connect your wallet and that's how you get phished.The original site is used for bnb chain airdrops having partnership with bnbchain. I remembered that I joined also some NFT projects airdrop and you have to connect wallet for claiming airdrop. Newbie could be easily decieved by the this phising site because most of them unaware of it, They just look for site look and didn't hesitate to connect main wallet for claiming airdrops.Thanks OP, i will add this phising site in my thread also and I hope that no one has been Targeted so far.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: BNB Airdrop I thought that the airdrop was linked to the currency in its first stage or before listing and not to a famous currency like BNB, or at least that it comes from Binance and not from an unknown site. These scammers create thousands of sites by modifying the template with meaningless words. I have reported it.
